recipesJson.name: Apple Butter | DEVELOPED
recipesJson.author: Developed
recipesJson.description:
This is an omage to Goldfish18's Apple Butta( https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/11595#apple_buttah_by_goldfish18 ) .  With so many new apples, butters, and caramels out now, we wanted to try to update Goldfish18's wonderful creation. This is a smooth, creamy, spiced apple "sauce" with hints of molasses and caramel.  See the full Episode and flavor notes at https://youtu.be/SNDFYe2Q9KE  .

This is a collaborative creation by DEVELOPED: NaChef, Max Savage, and Folkart.
Our weekly episodes are released at 6:00pm EST every other Tuesday, and catch our live shows every Thursday at 6pm EST.

Check out our website at https://www.DevelopedDIY.com - We now have Merch!
Find us on YouTube https://www.youtube.com/c/DevelopedDIY
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/developeddiy/
Check out our FaceBook Page at https://www.facebook.com/developeddiy/

![Legacy](https://imgur.com/LA0lhIG.png)

reviews.text: Well done guys, this is really nice even after 1h steep. This could be a great base for pastries, pies, you could mix it up with other fruits in place of apple too. I think it could be quite versatile. The Caramel Rice Crispy Treats has such a nice caramel note (also mixes well with banana) and the Molasses has a beautiful dark sweet note @ 1%. Great use of Custard Premium, bringin' tha butta. Apple Filling does a great job at giving the impression of apple with it's spiced and Country Apple holds up quite well against all of these. I'd been playing with apple pie filling and using a few apple flavours but this recipe again goes to show how simple is best and is a great reminder. Keep up the great work, the recipes I've mixed have been great so far.
Most of these flavors are exciting flavors to use, especially for the season. This mix is an awesome way to use all of them, and I can't put it down! Thanks for another banger
